"ESTO ES PARA TI"
La emotiva carta de Ricky Rubio a su madre, fallecida de cáncer en el 2016
En el artículo, el jugador hace un repaso de su carrera deportiva y le "regala" a su madre los éxitos cosechados
05 Nov 2019, 20:11 by El Periódico
Tras dedicar, el pasado mes de septiembre, el triunfo en la Copa Mundial de baloncesto de China 2019 a su madre, Ricky Rubio ha vuelto a abrir su corazón en una emotiva y desgarradora carta dirigida a ella en 'The Player's Tribune' en la que ha hecho un repaso de su carrera deportiva, probablemente en su mejor momento ahora mismo, a través de los sitios en los que ha ido creciendo. 
Además de por su impresionante carrera como jugador de baloncesto, Ricky Rubio es conocido por su labor al frente de su fundación en la lucha contra el cáncer, la Ricky Rubio Foundation. Tras el fallecimiento de su madre, Tona Vives, en el 2016 a causa de esta enfermedad, el jugador se ha involucrado de forma activa en campañas y actividades para recaudar fondos para combatir esta enfermedad. 
En la carta, Ricky cuenta cómo, en un viaje con sus padres en Minneapolis, los doctores dijeron a su madre que el cáncer había vuelto. "Tras dos horas, llegamos al destino: la Mayo Clinic, en Rochester. No era una situación nueva, mi madre había sido diagnosticada con cáncer en 2012 y lo venció, lo hicimos en familia. Pero estábamos allí de nuevo. Cuando vimos al doctor salir, lo supimos; era la misma cara que había puesto el doctor en Barcelona tres años antes cuando nos comunicó el cáncer. Y sí: había vuelto y se estaba reproduciendo rápido. Nos abrazamos. De camino a casa, mi padre no contó ninguna historia. Esa noche conocí algo más sobre mi apartamento: las paredes era muy finas. Escuché a mis padres llorar toda la noche. No lo puedo poner en palabras, pero estaba muy perdido, no quería acercarme al baloncesto y empecé a odiarlo", cuenta el jugador en su escrito. 
Así, con la misma naturalidad y con un extraño halo de cercanía, Ricky continúa contando cómo su madre, y su enfermedad, le han convertido en el hombre que es ahora.

text:
"THIS IS FOR YOU"
Ricky Rubio's emotional letter to his mother, who died of cancer in 2016
In the article, the player reviews his sports career and "gives" his mother the successes harvested
05 Nov 2019, 20:11 by El Periódico
After dedicating, last September, the triumph in the Chinese Basketball World Cup 2019 to his mother, Ricky Rubio has reopened his heart in an emotional and heartbreaking letter addressed to her in 'The Player's Tribune' in which He has reviewed his sports career, probably at his best right now, through the places where he has been growing.
In addition to his impressive career as a basketball player, Ricky Rubio is known for his work leading his foundation in the fight against cancer, the Ricky Rubio Foundation. After the death of his mother, Tona Vives, in 2016 because of this disease, the player has been actively involved in campaigns and activities to raise funds to combat this disease.
In the letter, Ricky tells how, on a trip with his parents in Minneapolis, doctors told his mother that the cancer was back. "After two hours, we arrived at the destination: the Mayo Clinic, in Rochester. It was not a new situation, my mother had been diagnosed with cancer in 2012 and defeated him, we did it as a family. But we were there again. When we saw the doctor To get out, we knew it; it was the same face that the doctor had put on in Barcelona three years before when he told us about the cancer.And yes: he had come back and was playing fast. We hugged each other. On the way home, my father didn't tell any story That night I met something else about my apartment: the walls were very thin. I heard my parents cry all night. I can't put it into words, but I was very lost, I didn't want to approach basketball and I started hating it, "he says. player in his writing.
Thus, with the same naturalness and with a strange halo of closeness, Ricky continues to tell how his mother, and his illness, have made him the man he is now.
